entities.description: Miina Härma was an Estonian composer. She was the second Estonian musician with higher education.

heading: Births
txt: Mrs. Patrick Campbell, English-French actress (d. 1940)

entities.title: Mrs. Patrick Campbell
entities.description: Mrs Patrick Campbell, born Beatrice Rose Stella Tanner and known informally as "Mrs Pat", was an English stage actress, best known for appearing in plays by Shakespeare, Shaw and Barrie. She also toured the United States and appeared briefly in films.

heading: Births
txt: Erich von Drygalski, German geographer and geophysicist (d. 1949)

heading: Births
txt: Natsume Sōseki, Japanese author and poet (d. 1916)

entities.title: Natsume Sōseki
entities.description: Natsume Sōseki , born Natsume Kin'nosuke , was a Japanese novelist. He is best known around the world for his novels Kokoro, Botchan, I Am a Cat and his unfinished work Light and Darkness. He was also a scholar of British literature and composer of haiku, kanshi, and fairy tales. From 1984 until 2004, his portrait appeared on the front of the Japanese 1000 yen note.

heading: Births
txt: Howard Taylor Ricketts, American pathologist and physician (d. 1910)

entities.title: Howard Taylor Ricketts
entities.description: Howard Taylor Ricketts was an American pathologist after whom the family Rickettsiaceae and the order Rickettsiales are named.

heading: Births
txt: Amy Lowell, American poet, critic, and educator (d. 1925)

entities.title: Amy Lowell
entities.description: Amy Lawrence Lowell was an American poet of the imagist school, which promoted a return to classical values. She posthumously won the Pulitzer Prize for Poetry in 1926.

heading: Births
txt: Arthur Edward Moore, New Zealand-Australian politician, 23rd Premier of Queensland (d. 1963)

entities.title: Arthur Edward Moore
entities.description: Arthur Edward Moore was an Australian politician. He was the Country and Progressive National Party Premier of Queensland, from 1929 to 1932. He was the only Queensland Premier not to come from the ranks of the Labor Party between 1915 and 1957. Although successful in achieving the unity of the conservative forces in Queensland for an extended period, Moore's abilities were tested by the onset of

entities.title: Premier of Queensland
entities.description: The Premier of Queensland is the head of government in the Australian state of Queensland.

heading: Births
txt: Jack Kirwan, Irish international footballer (d. 1959)

entities.title: Jack Kirwan
entities.description: John Henry Kirwan was an Irish football player and coach. As a player, he was described as an out and out winger with good pace and skills, playing as an outside-left for, among others, Everton, Tottenham Hotspur, Chelsea and Ireland. He had previously played gaelic football for Dublin. As a football coach he became the first professional manager of Dutch side Ajax. He was the last survivor of the

heading: Births
txt: Lipót Fejér, Hungarian mathematician and academic (d. 1959)

entities.title: Lipót Fejér
entities.description: Lipót Fejér was a Hungarian mathematician of Jewish heritage. Fejér was born Leopold Weisz, and changed to the Hungarian name Fejér around 1900.

heading: Births
txt: Jules Berry, French actor and director (d. 1951)

entities.title: Jules Berry
entities.description: Jules Berry was a French actor.

heading: Births
txt: Alban Berg, Austrian composer and educator (d. 1935)

entities.title: Alban Berg
entities.description: Alban Maria Johannes Berg was an Austrian composer of the Second Viennese School. His compositional style combined Romantic lyricism with the twelve-tone technique. Although he left a relatively small oeuvre, he is remembered as one of the most important composers of the 20th century for his expressive style encompassing "entire worlds of emotion and structure".

heading: Births
txt: Clarence H. Haring, American historian and author (d. 1960)

heading: Births
txt: Larry Semon, American actor, producer, director and screenwriter (d. 1928)

entities.title: Larry Semon
entities.description: Lawrence "Larry" Semon was an American actor, director, producer, and screenwriter during the silent film era. In his day, Semon was considered a major movie comedian, but he is now remembered mainly for working with both Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy before they started working together.

heading: Births
txt: Ronald Colman, English-American actor (d. 1958)

entities.title: Ronald Colman
entities.description: Ronald Charles Colman was an English-born actor, starting his career in theatre and silent film in his native country, then emigrating to the United States and having a successful Hollywood film career. He was most popular during the 1920s, 1930s and 1940s. He received Oscar nominations for Bulldog Drummond (1929), Condemned (1929) and Random Harvest (1942). Colman starred in several classic films

heading: Births
txt: Peggy Wood, American actress (d. 1978)

entities.title: Peggy Wood
entities.description: Mary Margaret Wood was an American actress of stage, film, and television. She is best remembered for her performance as the title character in the CBS television series Mama (1949–1957), for which she was nominated for a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series; her starring role as Naomi, Ruth's mother-in-law, in The Story of Ruth (1960); and her final screen appearanc

heading: Births
txt: Georgios Athanasiadis-Novas, Greek lawyer and politician, 163rd Prime Minister of Greece (d. 1987)

entities.title: Georgios Athanasiadis-Novas
entities.description:
Georgios Athanasiadis–Novas was a Greek poet, lawyer and politician who served as Prime Minister for one month in 1965.
Born in Nafpaktos, he obtained his law degree from the University of Athens. He was first elected to the Greek Parliament in 1926 representing his native prefecture of Aetolia-Acarnania, and was repeatedly elected to office until 1964.

entities.title: Prime Minister of Greece
entities.description: The prime minister of the Hellenic Republic, colloquially referred to as the prime minister of Greece, is the head of government of the Hellenic Republic and the leader of the Greek Cabinet. The incumbent prime minister is Kyriakos Mitsotakis, who took office on 8 July 2019.

heading: Births
txt: Hermann Brill, German lawyer and politician, 8th Minister-President of Thuringia (d. 1959)

entities.title: Hermann Brill
entities.description: Dr. Hermann Louis Brill was a German doctor of law and a politician (SPD).

entities.title: List of Ministers-President of Thuringia
entities.description: The office of Minister-President of Thuringia was established at the state's first formation in 1920. On 23 July 1952 the state, then part of the socialist German Democratic Republic, was abolished. On 3 October 1990, the state was re-established and joined the Federal Republic of Germany; since then it has been one of the country's sixteen constituent states (Länder).

heading: Births
txt: Alberto Vargas, Peruvian-American painter and illustrator (d. 1982)

entities.title: Alberto Vargas
entities.description: Joaquin Alberto Vargas y Chávez was a noted Peruvian painter of pin-up girls. He is often considered one of the most famous of the pin-up artists. Numerous Vargas paintings have sold and continue to sell for hundreds of thousands of dollars.

heading: Births
txt: Charles Kingsford Smith, Australian captain and pilot (d. 1935)

entities.title: Charles Kingsford Smith
entities.description: Sir Charles Edward Kingsford Smith, MC, AFC, often called by his nickname Smithy, was an early Australian aviator.

heading: Births
txt: Jūkichi Yagi, Japanese poet and educator (d. 1927)

entities.title: Jūkichi Yagi
entities.description: Jūkichi Yagi   was a Japanese poet active in the late Taishō period and for the first few years of the Shōwa period, who focused on modern religious themes.

heading: Births
txt: Brian Donlevy, American actor (d. 1972)

entities.title: Brian Donlevy
entities.description: Waldo Brian Donlevy was an American actor, noted for playing dangerous tough guys from the 1930s to the 1960s. He usually appeared in supporting roles. Among his best-known films are Beau Geste (1939), The Great McGinty (1940) and Wake Island (1942), in which he played the lead. For his role as Sergeant Markoff in Beau Geste, he was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor.

heading: Births
txt: James Murray, American actor (d. 1936)

heading: Births
txt: David Cecil, 6th Marquess of Exeter, English hurdler and politician (d. 1981)

entities.title: David Cecil, 6th Marquess of Exeter
entities.description: David George Brownlow Cecil, 6th Marquess of Exeter KCMG OLY, styled Lord Burghley before 1956 and also known as David Burghley, was an English athlete, sports official, peer, and Conservative Party politician. He won the gold medal in the 400 m hurdles at the 1928 Summer Olympics.

heading: Births
txt: André Kostolany, Hungarian-French economist and journalist (d. 1999)

entities.title: André Kostolany
entities.description: André Kostolany was a stock market expert, bon vivant and Chevalier de la Légion d'Honneur. He worked most of his life in France and Germany.

heading: Births
txt: Trường Chinh, Vietnamese politician, 4th President of Vietnam (d. 1988)

entities.title: Trường Chinh
entities.description: Trường Chinh was a Vietnamese communist political leader and theoretician. He was one of the key figures of Vietnamese politics. He played a major role in the anti-French colonialism movement and finally after decades of protracted war in Vietnam, the Vietnamese defeated the colonial power. He was the think-tank of the Communist Party who determined the direction of the communist movement, particu

entities.title: List of Presidents of Vietnam
entities.description: The President of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, known as Chairman of the Council of State from 1981 to 1992, is the head of state of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. Beside, the president is also the head of government with prime minister. Since Vietnam is a single-party state, the president is generally considered to hold the second highest position in the political system, after the Genera

heading: Births
txt: Harold Scott MacDonald Coxeter, English-Canadian mathematician and academic (d. 2003)

heading: Births
txt: Heather Angel, English-American actress (d. 1986)

entities.title: Heather Angel (actress)
entities.description: Heather Grace Angel was an British-American actress. She has been known for providing the voice of Mrs. Darling, Wendy's mother in Peter Pan and Alice's sister in Alice in wonderland.

heading: Births
txt: Carmen Miranda, Portuguese-Brazilian actress, singer, and dancer (d. 1955)

entities.title: United States Secretary of State
entities.description: The United States secretary of state implements foreign policy for the U.S. government as the head of the U.S. Department of State. Created in 1789, the Cabinet position is analogous to a foreign minister in other countries.

heading: Births
txt: Jacques Monod, French biochemist and geneticist, Nobel Prize laureate (d. 1976)

entities.title: Jacques Monod
entities.description: Jacques Lucien Monod was a French biochemist who won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1965, sharing it with François Jacob and André Lwoff "for their discoveries concerning genetic control of enzyme and virus synthesis".

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is awarded yearly by the Nobel Assembly at the Karolinska Institutet for outstanding discoveries in physiology or medicine.

heading: Births
txt: William Orlando Darby, American general (d. 1945)

entities.title: William Orlando Darby
entities.description: William O. Darby was a career United States Army officer who fought in World War II, where he was killed in action in Italy. He was posthumously promoted to brigadier general. Darby led the famous Darby's Rangers, which evolved into the United States Army Rangers.

heading: Births
txt: Futabayama Sadaji, Japanese sumo wrestler, the 35th Yokozuna (d. 1968)

entities.title: Futabayama Sadaji
entities.description: Futabayama Sadaji  was a Japanese professional sumo wrestler from Oita Prefecture. Entering sumo in 1927, he was the sport's 35th yokozuna from 1937 until his retirement in 1945. He won twelve yūshō or top division championships and had a winning streak of 69 consecutive bouts, an all-time record. Despite his dominance he was extremely popular with the public. After his retirement he was head coac

entities.title: Makuuchi
entities.description: Makuuchi (幕内), or makunouchi (幕の内), is the top division of the six divisions of professional sumo. Its size is fixed at 42 wrestlers (rikishi), ordered into five ranks according to their ability as defined by their performance in previous tournaments.

heading: Births
txt: Ginette Leclerc, French actress (d. 1992)

heading: Births
txt: Ernest Tubb, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (d. 1984)

entities.title: Ernest Tubb
entities.description: Ernest Dale Tubb, nicknamed the Texas Troubadour, was an American singer and songwriter and one of the pioneers of country music. His biggest career hit song, "Walking the Floor Over You" (1941), marked the rise of the honky tonk style of music.

heading: Births
txt: Tex Hughson, American baseball player (d. 1993)

entities.title: Tex Hughson
entities.description: Cecil Carlton Hughson, was a Major League Baseball starting pitcher who played his entire career in the American League with the Boston Red Sox. He batted and threw right-handed.

entities.title: Lloyd Noel Ferguson
entities.description: Lloyd Noel Ferguson was an American chemist.

entities.title: Fred Allen (rugby union)
entities.description: Sir Frederick Richard Allen was a captain and coach of the All Blacks, New Zealand's national rugby union team. The All Blacks won all 14 of the test matches they played under his coaching.

entities.title: The Leela Palaces, Hotels and Resorts
entities.description: The Leela Palaces, Hotels and Resorts, commonly known as The Leela, is an Indian luxury hotel chain, founded in 1986 by C. P. Krishnan Nair, and owned by Brookfield Asset Management. Currently, The Leela is a group of eight luxury palaces and hotels.

entities.title: Brendan Behan
entities.description: Brendan Francis Aidan Behan was an Irish poet, short story writer, novelist and playwright who wrote in both English and Irish. He was named by Irish Central as one of the greatest Irish writers of all time.

heading: Births
txt: John B. Cobb, American philosopher and theologian

entities.title: John B. Cobb
entities.description: John Boswell Cobb, Jr. is an American theologian, philosopher, and environmentalist. Cobb is often regarded as the preeminent scholar in the field of process philosophy and process theology, the school of thought associated with the philosophy of Alfred North Whitehead. Cobb is the author of more than fifty books. In 2014, Cobb was elected to the prestigious American Academy of Arts and Sciences.

heading: Births
txt: Burkhard Heim, German physicist and academic (d. 2001)

heading: Births
txt: Garret FitzGerald, Irish lawyer and politician, 7th Taoiseach of Ireland (d. 2011)

He served as Leader of Fine Gael from 1977 to 1987, and was twice Leader of the Opposition between 1977 and 1982; he was previously Minister for Foreign Affairs from 1973 to 1977. FitzGerald served as a Teachta Dála (TD) from 1969 to 1992 a

heading: Births
txt: Richard A. Long, American historian and author (d. 2013)

entities.title: Richard A. Long
entities.description: Richard V. Long is an American cultural historian and author, who has been called "one of the great pillars of African-American arts and culture". heading: Births
txt: Frank Frazetta, American painter and illustrator (d. 2010)

entities.title: Frank Frazetta
entities.description: Frank Frazetta was an American fantasy and science fiction artist, noted for comic books, paperback book covers, paintings, posters, LP record album covers and other media. He is often referred to as the "Godfather" of fantasy art, and one of the most renowned illustrators of the 20th century. He was also the subject of a 2003 documentary Painting with Fire.

Earlier he had been the Chief Minister of the state of Maharashtra, but was forced to resign after being convicted by the Bombay High Court on charges that he had extorted money for a trust fund he managed.

entities.title: Chief Minister of Maharashtra
entities.description: The Chief Minister of Maharashtra is the head of the Government of the Indian state of Maharashtra. Following elections to the Legislative Assembly, the Governor invites the party with a majority of seats to form the government and appoints the Chief Minister (CM). If the appointee is not a member of either the Legislative Assembly or the Legislative Council of Maharashtra, then the Constitution s

txt: Garner Ted Armstrong, American evangelist and author (d. 2003)

entities.description: Garner Ted Armstrong was an American evangelist and the son of Herbert W. Armstrong, founder of the Worldwide Church of God, at the time a Sabbatarian organization that taught observance of seventh-day Sabbath, and annual Sabbath days based on Leviticus 23.

txt: Thomas Bernhard, Austrian author, poet, and playwright (d. 1989)

entities.title: Thomas Bernhard
entities.description: Nicolaas Thomas Bernhard was an Austrian novelist, playwright and poet. Bernhard's body of work has been called "the most significant literary achievement since World War II." He is widely considered to be one of the most important German-speaking authors of the postwar era.

entities.description: Matthias II was Duke of Lorraine from 1220 to his death. He was the son of Duke Frederick II and Agnes of Bar and succeeded his brother, Theobald I.

heading: Deaths
txt: William I, margrave of Meissen (b. 1343)

entities.title: William I, Margrave of Meissen
entities.description: William I, the one-eyed, was Margrave of Meissen. His surname is related to the legend that Saint Benno appeared to him because of his disputes with the Church in a dream and he had an eye gouged out.

heading: Deaths
txt: Agnès Sorel, French mistress of Charles VII of France (b. 1421)

entities.title: Agnès Sorel
entities.description: Agnès Sorel, known by the sobriquet Dame de beauté, was a favourite and chief mistress of King Charles VII of France, by whom she bore four daughters. She is considered the first officially recognized royal mistress of a French king. She was the subject of several contemporary paintings and works of art, including Jean Fouquet's Virgin and Child Surrounded by Angels.

entities.title: Charles VII of France
entities.description: Charles VII, called the Victorious or the Well-Served, was King of France from 1422 to his death in 1461.

heading: Deaths
txt: John Hooper, English bishop and martyr (b. 1495)

entities.title: John Hooper (bishop)
entities.description: John Hooper was an English churchman, Anglican Bishop of Gloucester, and Worcester, a Protestant reformer and a Protestant martyr. A proponent of the English Reformation, he was executed for heresy by burning during the reign of Queen Mary I.

heading: Deaths
txt: Rowland Taylor, English priest and martyr (b. 1510)

heading: Deaths
txt: Álvaro de Bazán, 1st Marquis of Santa Cruz, Spanish admiral (b. 1526)

entities.title: Álvaro de Bazán, 1st Marquis of Santa Cruz
entities.description: Álvaro de Bazán, 1st Marquess of Santa Cruz, GE, KOS, was a Spanish admiral. He was never defeated, a remarkable achievement in a fifty-year long career. His personal galley, La Loba, thus called by her golden figurehead, was feared by Spanish enemies and regarded with hope amongst Spanish sailors and allies.

heading: Deaths
txt: John Frederick, Duke of Pomerania (b. 1542)

entities.title: John Frederick, Duke of Pomerania
entities.description: John Frederick was Duke of Pomerania from 1560 to 1600, and Bishop of Cammin (Kamień) from 1556 to 1574. Elected bishop in 1556 and heir of the duchy in 1560, he remained under tutelage of his great-uncle Barnim XI until he took on his offices in 1567.

heading: Deaths
txt: Lucilio Vanini, Italian physician and philosopher (b. 1585)

entities.title: Lucilio Vanini
entities.description: Lucilio Vanini, who, in his works, styled himself Giulio Cesare Vanini, was an Italian philosopher, physician and free-thinker, who was one of the first significant representatives of intellectual libertinism. He was among the first modern thinkers who viewed the universe as an entity governed by natural laws. He was also an early literate proponent of biological evolution, maintaining that humans

heading: Deaths
txt: Murad IV, Ottoman Sultan (b. 1612)

entities.title: Murad IV
entities.description: Murad IV was the Sultan of the Ottoman Empire from 1623 to 1640, known both for restoring the authority of the state and for the brutality of his methods. Murad IV was born in Constantinople, the son of Sultan Ahmed I and Kösem Sultan. He was brought to power by a palace conspiracy in 1623, and he succeeded his uncle Mustafa I. He was only 11 when he ascended the throne. His reign is most notable

entities.title: Ottoman Sultan
entities.description: The sultans of the Ottoman Empire, who were all members of the Ottoman dynasty, ruled over the transcontinental empire from its perceived inception in 1299 to its dissolution in 1922. At its height, the Ottoman Empire spanned an area from Hungary in the north to Yemen in the south, and from Algeria in the west to Iraq in the east. Administered at first from the city of Söğüt since before 1280 and

heading: Deaths
txt: Frederick III of Denmark (b. 1609)

entities.title: Frederick III of Denmark
entities.description: Frederick III was king of Denmark and Norway from 1648 until his death in 1670. He also governed under the name Frederick II as diocesan administrator of the Prince-Bishopric of Verden, and the Prince-Archbishopric of Bremen (1635–45).

heading: Deaths
txt: Gerrit Dou, Dutch painter (b. 1613)

entities.title: Gerrit Dou
entities.description: Gerrit Dou, also known as Gerard Douw or Dow, was a Dutch Golden Age painter, whose small, highly polished paintings are typical of the Leiden fijnschilders. He specialised in genre scenes and is noted for his trompe-l'œil "niche" paintings and candlelit night-scenes with strong chiaroscuro. He was a student of Rembrandt.

heading: Deaths
txt: François Louis, Prince of Conti (b. 1664)

entities.title: François Louis, Prince of Conti
entities.description: François Louis de Bourbon, le Grand Conti, was Prince de Conti, succeeding his brother, Louis Armand de Bourbon, in 1685. Until this date, he used the title of Prince of La Roche-sur-Yon. He was son of Armand de Bourbon, Prince of Conti and Anne Marie Martinozzi, daughter of Girolamo Martinozzi and niece of Cardinal Mazarin, through her mother. He was proclaimed as the King of Poland in 1697. He i

heading: Deaths
txt: Seth Pomeroy, American general and gunsmith (b. 1706)

entities.title: Seth Pomeroy
entities.description: Seth Pomeroy was an American gunsmith and soldier from Northampton, Massachusetts. His military service included the French and Indian War and the early stages of the American Revolutionary War. He fought as a private soldier in the Battle of Bunker Hill, but was later appointed a major general in the Massachusetts militia.

heading: Deaths
txt: Jean François de Saint-Lambert, French soldier, poet, and philosopher (b. 1716)

entities.title: Jean François de Saint-Lambert
entities.description: Jean François de Saint-Lambert was a French poet, philosopher and military officer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Dionysios Solomos, Greek poet and translator (b. 1798)

entities.title: Dionysios Solomos
entities.description: Dionysios Solomos was a Greek poet from Zakynthos. He is best known for writing the Hymn to Liberty, of which the first two stanzas, set to music by Nikolaos Mantzaros, became the Greek and Cypriot national anthem in 1865 and 1966 respectively. He was the central figure of the Heptanese School of poetry, and is considered the national poet of Greece—not only because he wrote the national anthem, b

heading: Deaths
txt: Jules Michelet, French historian, philosopher, and academic (b. 1798)

entities.title: Jules Michelet
entities.description: Jules Michelet was a French historian. He was born in Paris to a family with Huguenot traditions.

heading: Deaths
txt: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, Russian novelist, short story writer, essayist, and philosopher (b. 1821)

entities.title: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
entities.description: Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky, sometimes transliterated as Dostoyevsky, was a Russian novelist, philosopher, short story writer, essayist, and journalist. Dostoevsky's literary works explore human psychology in the troubled political, social, and spiritual atmospheres of 19th-century Russia, and engage with a variety of philosophical and religious themes. His most acclaimed works include Crime an

heading: Deaths
txt: Johan Jongkind, Dutch painter (b. 1819)

entities.title: Johan Jongkind
entities.description: Johan Barthold Jongkind was a Dutch painter and printmaker. He painted marine landscapes in a free manner and is regarded as a forerunner of Impressionism.

heading: Deaths
txt: Charles Gavan Duffy, Irish-Australian politician, 8th Premier of Victoria (b. 1816)

entities.title: Charles Gavan Duffy
entities.description: Sir Charles Gavan Duffy, KCMG, PC, was an Irish poet and journalist, Young Irelander and tenant-rights activist. After emigrating to Australia in 1856 he entered the politics of Victoria on a platform of land reform, and in 1871-72 served as the colony's 8th Premier.

entities.title: Premier of Victoria
entities.description: The Premier of Victoria is the head of government in the Australian state of Victoria. The Premier is appointed by the governor of Victoria, and is the leader of the political party able to secure a majority in the Victorian Legislative Assembly.

heading: Deaths
txt: Paul Laurence Dunbar, American author, poet, and playwright (b. 1872)

entities.title: Paul Laurence Dunbar
entities.description: Paul Laurence Dunbar was an American poet, novelist, and short story writer of the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Born in Dayton, Ohio, to parents who had been enslaved in Kentucky before the American Civil War, Dunbar began writing stories and verse when he was a child. He published his first poems at the age of 16 in a Dayton newspaper, and served as president of his high school's literary

heading: Deaths
txt: William Gillies, Australian politician, 21st Premier of Queensland (b. 1868)

entities.title: William Gillies (Australian politician)
entities.description: William Neal Gillies was Labor Premier of Queensland from 26 February 1925 to 22 October 1925.

entities.title: Premier of Queensland
entities.description: The Premier of Queensland is the head of government in the Australian state of Queensland.

heading: Deaths
txt: Richard With, Norwegian captain and businessman, founded Hurtigruten (b. 1846)

entities.title: Richard With
entities.description: Richard Bernhard With was a Norwegian ship captain, businessman and politician for the Liberal Left Party. He is known as the founder of the shipping companies Vesteraalens Dampskibsselskab and Hurtigruten.

entities.title: Hurtigruten
entities.description: Hurtigruten, formally Kystruten Bergen-Kirkenes, is a Norwegian public coastal route transporting passengers that travel locally, regionally and between the ports of call, and also cargo between ports north of Tromsø.

heading: Deaths
txt: Junnosuke Inoue, Japanese businessman and banker (b. 1869)

entities.title: Junnosuke Inoue
entities.description: Junnosuke Inoue  was a Japanese businessman and central banker. He was the 9th and 11th Governor of the Bank of Japan (BOJ).

heading: Deaths
txt: A.K. Golam Jilani, Bangladeshi soldier and activist (b. 1904)

heading: Deaths
txt: Ella D. Barrier, American educator (b. 1852)

entities.title: Ella D. Barrier
entities.description: Ella D. Barrier was an American educator and clubwoman. Her younger sister was Fannie Barrier Williams.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ted Theodore, Australian politician, 20th Premier of Queensland (b. 1884)

entities.title: Ted Theodore
entities.description: Edward Granville Theodore was an Australian politician who served as Premier of Queensland from 1919 to 1925, as leader of the state Labor Party. He later entered federal politics, serving as Treasurer in the Labor Scullin Government.

entities.title: Premier of Queensland
entities.description: The Premier of Queensland is the head of government in the Australian state of Queensland.

heading: Deaths
txt: Eddy Duchin, American pianist, bandleader, and actor (b. 1910)

entities.title: Eddy Duchin
entities.description: Edwin Frank Duchin was an American jazz pianist and bandleader during the 1930s and 1940s.

heading: Deaths
txt: Miklós Horthy, Hungarian admiral and politician, Regent of Hungary (b. 1868)

entities.title: Miklós Horthy
entities.description: Miklós Horthy de Nagybánya was a Hungarian admiral and statesman who served as the regent of the Kingdom of Hungary between the two World Wars and throughout most of World War II, from 1 March 1920 to 15 October 1944.

entities.title: Regent of Hungary
entities.description: The Regent of Hungary was a position established in 1446 and renewed in 1920. It was held by Admiral Miklós Horthy until 1944. Under Hungary's Constitution there were two regents, one a regent of the ruling house, called the Nádor, and another called "Kormányzó". As the Entente had banned the legitimate Nádor from taking his place, the choice fell on electing a governor-regent: Admiral Horthy was

heading: Deaths
txt: Alexandre Benois, Russian painter and critic (b. 1870)

entities.title: Alexandre Benois
entities.description: Alexandre Nikolayevich Benois was a Russian artist, art critic, historian, preservationist and founding member of Mir iskusstva, an art movement and magazine. As a designer for the Ballets Russes under Sergei Diaghilev, Benois exerted what is considered a seminal influence on the modern ballet and stage design.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ernő Dohnányi, Hungarian pianist, composer, and conductor (b. 1877)

heading: Deaths
txt: Khan Bahadur Ahsanullah, Bangladeshi theologian and educator (b. 1874)

entities.title: Khan Bahadur Ahsanullah
entities.description: Khan Bahadur Ahsanullah was an educator, litterateur, Islamic theologist and social reformer of Pre-partition India. He was instrumental in the formation of the University of Dhaka and is the namesake of Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology.

heading: Deaths
txt: Sophie Tucker, Russian-born American singer (b. 1884)

entities.title: Sophie Tucker
entities.description: Sophie Tucker was a Russian-born American singer, comedian, actress, and radio personality. Known for her powerful delivery of comical and risqué songs, she was one of the more popular entertainers in the U.S. during the first half of the 20th century. She was known by the nickname "The Last of the Red Hot Mamas".

heading: Deaths
txt: George "Gabby" Hayes, American actor and singer (b. 1885)

entities.title: George "Gabby" Hayes
entities.description: George Francis "Gabby" Hayes, was an American actor. He began as something of a leading man and a character player, but he was best known for his numerous appearances in B-Western film series as the bewhiskered, cantankerous, woman-hating, but ever-loyal and brave comic sidekick of the cowboy stars Hopalong Cassidy and Roy Rogers.

heading: Deaths
txt: Percy Faith, Canadian composer and conductor (b. 1908)

entities.title: Percy Faith
entities.description: Percy Faith was a Canadian bandleader, orchestrator, composer and conductor, known for his lush arrangements of pop and Christmas standards. He is often credited with popularizing the "easy listening" or "mood music" format. Faith became a staple of American popular music in the 1950s and continued well into the 1960s. Though his professional orchestra-leading career began at the height of the swi

heading: Deaths
txt: Sergey Ilyushin, Russian engineer and businessman, founded the Ilyushin Design Company (b. 1894)

entities.title: Sergey Ilyushin
entities.description: Sergey Vladimirovich Ilyushin was a Soviet aircraft designer who founded the Ilyushin aircraft design bureau. He designed the Il-2 Shturmovik, which made its maiden flight in 1939. It is the most produced warplane, and remains the second most-produced aircraft in history, with some 36,000+ built, behind the US Cessna 172.

entities.title: Ilyushin
entities.description: The public joint stock company Ilyushin Aviation Complex, operating as "Ilyushin" or as "Ilyushin Design Bureau", is a former Soviet and now a Russian aircraft manufacturer and design bureau, founded in 1933 by Sergey Vladimirovich Ilyushin. Soviet/Russian nomenclature identifies aircraft from Ilyushin with the prefix "Il-". Ilyushin has its head office in Aeroport District, Northern Administrativ

heading: Deaths
txt: Costante Girardengo, Italian cyclist and coach (b. 1893)

entities.title: Costante Girardengo
entities.description: Costante Girardengo was an Italian professional road bicycle racer, considered by many to be one of the finest riders in the history of the sport. He was the first rider to be declared a "Campionissimo" or "champion of champions" by the Italian media and fans. At the height of his popularity in the 1920s he was said to be more popular than Mussolini and it was decreed that all express trains shoul

heading: Deaths
txt: Allen Tate, American poet and academic (b. 1899)

entities.title: Allen Tate
entities.description: John Orley Allen Tate, known professionally as Allen Tate, was an American poet, essayist, social commentator, and Poet Laureate from 1943 to 1944.

heading: Deaths
txt: Tom Macdonald, Welsh journalist and author (b. 1900)

entities.title: Tom Macdonald (writer)
entities.description: Tom Macdonald (1900–1980) was a Welsh journalist and novelist, whose most significant publication was his highly evocative account of growing up in the north of Cardiganshire in the years before the Great War, which was published in 1975 as The White Lanes of Summer.

heading: Deaths
txt: M. C. Chagla, Indian jurist and politician, Indian Minister of External Affairs (b. 1900)

entities.title: M. C. Chagla
entities.description: Mohammadali Carim Chagla was an Indian jurist, diplomat, and Cabinet Minister who served as Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court from 1947 to 1958.

entities.title: Minister of External Affairs (India)
entities.description: The Minister of External Affairs is the head of the Ministry of External Affairs of the Government of India. One of the senior-most offices in the Union Cabinet, the chief responsibility of the Foreign Minister is to represent India and its government in the international community. The Foreign Minister also plays an important role in determining Indian foreign policy. Occasionally, the Foreign Mi

heading: Deaths
txt: Bill Haley, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (b. 1925)

heading: Deaths
txt: Yuri Andropov, Russian lawyer and politician (b. 1914)

entities.title: Yuri Andropov
entities.description: Yuri Vladimirovich Andropov was the sixth paramount leader of the Soviet Union and the fourth General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union. Following the 18-year rule of Leonid Brezhnev, Andropov served in the post from November 1982 until his death in February 1984.

heading: Deaths
txt: Osamu Tezuka, Japanese illustrator, animator, and producer (b. 1928)

entities.title: Osamu Tezuka
entities.description: Osamu Tezuka was a Japanese manga artist, cartoonist, and animator. Born in Osaka Prefecture, his prolific output, pioneering techniques, and innovative redefinitions of genres earned him such titles as "the Father of Manga" , "the Godfather of Manga"  and "the God of Manga" . Additionally, he is often considered the Japanese equivalent to Walt Disney, who served as a major inspiration during Tezu

heading: Deaths
txt: Howard Martin Temin, American geneticist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1934)

entities.title: Howard Martin Temin
entities.description: Howard Martin Temin was a US geneticist and virologist. He discovered reverse transcriptase in the 1970s at the University of Wisconsin–Madison, for which he shared the 1975 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with Renato Dulbecco and David Baltimore.

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is awarded yearly by the Nobel Assembly at the Karolinska Institutet for outstanding discoveries in physiology or medicine.

heading: Deaths
txt: J. William Fulbright, American lawyer and politician (b. 1905)

entities.title: J. William Fulbright
entities.description: James William Fulbright was an American politician, academic, and statesman who represented Arkansas in the United States Senate from 1945 until his resignation in 1974. As of 2021, Fulbright is the longest serving chairman in the history of the United States Senate Committee on Foreign Relations. txt: Kalevi Keihänen, Finnish entrepreneur (b. 1924)

heading: Deaths
txt: David Wayne, American actor (b. 1914)

heading: Deaths
txt: Maurice Schumann, French journalist and politician, French Minister of Foreign Affairs (b. 1911)

entities.title: Maurice Schumann
entities.description: Maurice Schumann was a French politician, journalist, writer, and hero of the Second World War who served as Minister of Foreign Affairs under Georges Pompidou from 22 June 1969 to 15 March 1973. Schumann was a member of the Christian democratic Popular Republican Movement.

entities.title: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Development (France)
entities.description: The Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs is the ministry of the Government of France that handles France's foreign relations. Since 1855, its headquarters have been located at 37 Quai d'Orsay, close to the National Assembly. The term Quai d'Orsay is often used as a metonym for the ministry. Its cabinet minister, the Minister for Europe and Foreign Affairs is responsible for the foreign relation

heading: Deaths
txt: Herbert A. Simon, American political scientist, economist, and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1916)

entities.title: Herbert A. Simon
entities.description: Herbert Alexander Simon was an American economist, political scientist and cognitive psychologist, whose primary research interest was decision-making within organizations and is best known for the theories of "bounded rationality" and "satisficing". He received the Nobel Prize in Economics in 1978 and the Turing Award in 1975. His research was noted for its interdisciplinary nature and spanned ac

entities.title: Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences
entities.description: The Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences, officially the Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel, is an economics prize administered by the Nobel Foundation. While it is not one of the Nobel Prizes, which were established by Alfred Nobel's will in 1895, it is commonly referred to as the Nobel Prize in Economics. The prize was established in 1968 by a donation fr

heading: Deaths
txt: Isabelle Holland, Swiss-American author (b. 1920)

entities.title: Isabelle Holland
entities.description: Isabelle Christian Holland was an American author of fiction for children and adults. She wrote gothic novels, adult mysteries, romantic thrillers and many books for children and young adults.

heading: Deaths
txt: Princess Margaret, Countess of Snowdon (b. 1930)

heading: Deaths
txt: Masatoshi Gündüz Ikeda, Japanese-Turkish mathematician and academic (b. 1926)

entities.title: Masatoshi Gündüz Ikeda
entities.description: Masatoşi Gündüz İkeda, was a Japanese-born Turkish mathematician known for his contributions to the field of algebraic number theory.

heading: Deaths
txt: Claude Ryan, Canadian journalist and politician (b. 1925)

entities.title: Claude Ryan
entities.description: Claude Ryan, was a Canadian journalist and politician. He was the director of the newspaper Le Devoir from 1964 to 1978, leader of the Quebec Liberal Party from 1978 to 1982, National Assembly of Quebec member for Argenteuil from 1979 to 1994 and Minister of Education from 1985 to 1989.

heading: Deaths
txt: Robert Kearns, American engineer, invented the windscreen wiper (b. 1927)

entities.title: Robert Kearns
entities.description: Robert William Kearns was an American engineer, educator and inventor who invented the most common intermittent windshield wiper systems used on most automobiles from 1969 to the present. His first patent for the invention was filed on December 1, 1964, after a few previous designs by other inventors had failed to gain any traction in manufacturing.

entities.title: Windscreen wiper
entities.description: A windscreen wiper or windshield wiper is a device used to remove rain, snow, ice, washer fluid, water, and/or debris from a vehicle's front window so the vehicle's operator can better see what's ahead of them. Almost all motor vehicles, including cars, trucks, buses, train locomotives, and watercraft with a cabin—and some aircraft—are equipped with one or more such wipers, which are usually a leg

heading: Deaths
txt: Freddie Laker, English pilot and businessman, founded Laker Airways (b. 1922)

entities.title: Freddie Laker
entities.description: Sir Frederick Alfred Laker was an English airline entrepreneur, best known for founding Laker Airways in 1966, which went bankrupt in 1982. Known as Freddie Laker, he was one of the first airline owners to adopt the "low cost / no-frills" airline business model that has since proven to be very successful worldwide with companies such as Norwegian Air, Ryanair, easyJet, AirAsia and WestJet.

entities.title: Laker Airways
entities.description: Laker Airways was a private British airline founded by Sir Freddie Laker in 1966. It was originally a charter airline flying passengers and cargo worldwide. Its head office was located at Gatwick Airport in Crawley, England.

heading: Deaths
txt: Hank Bauer, American baseball player and manager (b. 1922)

entities.title: Hank Bauer
entities.description: Henry Albert Bauer was an American right fielder and manager in Major League Baseball. He played with the New York Yankees (1948–1959) and Kansas City Athletics (1960–1961); he batted and threw right-handed. heading: Deaths
txt: Ian Richardson, Scottish actor (b. 1934)

heading: Deaths
txt: Christopher Hyatt, American occultist and author (b. 1943)

entities.title: Christopher Hyatt
entities.description: Christopher Hyatt, born Alan Ronald Miller, was an American psychologist, occultist, and author. entities.description: Candelario Orlando López Vergara, better known as Cachaíto, was a Cuban bassist and composer, who gained international fame after his involvement in the Buena Vista Social Club recordings. He was nicknamed Cachaíto after his uncle, the famous bassist and innovator of mambo music Israel "Cachao" López. His father and Cachao's older brother was Orestes López, also a famous bassist/multi-instrumental

heading: Deaths
txt: Walter Frederick Morrison, American businessman, invented the Frisbee (b. 1920)

entities.title: Walter Frederick Morrison
entities.description: Walter Fredrick "Fred" Morrison was an American inventor and entrepreneur, who invented the Frisbee.

entities.title: Frisbee
entities.description: A frisbee is a gliding toy or sporting item that is generally made of injection-molded plastic and roughly 8 to 10 inches in diameter with a pronounced lip. It is used recreationally and competitively for throwing and catching, as in flying disc games. heading: Deaths
txt: Miltiadis Evert, Greek lawyer and politician, 69th Mayor of Athens (b. 1939)

entities.title: Miltiadis Evert
entities.description: Miltiadis Evert was a Greek politician, a member of Parliament, government minister, and ex-chairman of the New Democracy party.

entities.title: Mayor of Athens
entities.description: The Mayor of Athens is the head of the Municipality of Athens, the largest district of the Athens.

entities.description: O.P. Dutta an Indian filmmaker and writer, was born in Gujranwala, British India to a Punjabi Brahmin family. He began his career in 1948, as director for the film, 'Pyar Ki Jeet', which starred actress-singer, Suraiya. The film catapulted her to a 'Super Star' sensation. txt: John Hick, English philosopher and academic (b. 1922)

txt: Joe Moretti, Scottish-South African guitarist and songwriter (b. 1938)

heading: Deaths
txt: Richard Artschwager, American painter, illustrator, and sculptor (b. 1923)

entities.title: Richard Artschwager
entities.description: Richard Ernst Artschwager was an American painter, illustrator and sculptor. His work has associations with Pop Art, Conceptual art and Minimalism.

txt: Keiko Fukuda, Japanese-American martial artist and trainer (b. 1913)

entities.description: Axel Gabriel Erik Mørch better known as Gabriel Axel was a Danish film director, actor, writer and producer, best known for Babette's Feast (1987), which he wrote and directed.

entities.title: Liu Han
entities.description: Liu Han was a Chinese billionaire businessman, the former chairman of the conglomerate Hanlong Group, with interests in power generation and mining. His assets were officially valued at 40 billion yuan. He was convicted of murder, running a mafia-style gang, and many other charges, and executed in February 2015.

entities.title: NFL Films
entities.description: NFL Productions, LLC, doing business as NFL Films, is the film and television production company of the National Football League. It produces commercials, television programs, feature films, and documentaries for and about (NFL), as well as other unrelated major events and awards shows. heading: Deaths
txt: Sushil Koirala, Nepalese politician, 37th Prime Minister of Nepal (b. 1939)

entities.title: Sushil Koirala
entities.description: Sushil Koirala was a Nepalese politician and the Prime Minister of Nepal from 11 February 2014 to 10 October 2015. He was also President of the Nepali Congress from 2010 to 2016, having earlier served under various capacities in the party.

entities.title: Prime Minister of Nepal
entities.description: The prime minister of Nepal is the head of government and chief executive of Nepal. The prime minister is the chair of the Council of Ministers of Nepal and the chief adviser to the President of Nepal. The Prime Minister is a member of the House of Representatives of Nepal and is the highest ranking federal officer within the government.

txt: André Salvat, French Army colonel (b. 1920)

entities.title: André Salvat
entities.description: André Salvat was a colonel in the French Army. He was a veteran of World War II, the First Indochina War and the Algerian War. He was made a Companion of the Liberation for his World War II service.

txt: John Gavin,  American actor and United States ambassador to Mexico (b. 1931)

entities.title: United States ambassador to Mexico
entities.description: The United States has maintained diplomatic relations with Mexico since 1823, when Andrew Jackson was appointed Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to that country. Jackson declined the appointment, however, and Joel R. Poinsett became the first U.S. envoy to Mexico in 1825. heading: Deaths
txt: Chick Corea, American jazz composer (b. 1941)

entities.title: Chick Corea
entities.description: Armando Anthony "Chick" Corea was an American jazz composer, keyboardist, bandleader, and occasional percussionist. His compositions "Spain", "500 Miles High", "La Fiesta", "Armando's Rhumba" and "Windows" are widely considered jazz standards. As a member of Miles Davis's band in the late 1960s, he participated in the birth of jazz fusion. In the 1970s he formed Return to Forever. Along with Herbi
